intro: Monnina grandifolia, commonly known as the largeflower bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, delicate blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Monnina grandifolia is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to arid environments.
